algorithm_technique: Iterate through the string, accumulating width per line and starting a new line when 100 is exceeded.
problem_summary_simple: Determine the number of lines and the width of the last line to write a string within a 100-pixel width limit per line.
problem_summary_technical: Greedy simulation: iterate through characters, add width to current line, increment line count and reset width if limit is exceeded.
key_insights: The problem requires simulating the writing process line by line.
Maintain a running width for the current line.
When the current line's width exceeds 100, increment the line count and reset the current line's width to the width of the current character.
